intro: Chionolaena glomerata, commonly known as the woolly leaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in coastal areas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Chionolaena glomerata is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
